oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Portrait photographs; Civil wars; Firearms; Knives; Arms & armament; Military uniforms
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Confederate States of America. Army
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three-quarter length portrait of Henry Howe Cook. Inscription on the back of the photograph reads, "Photo of Henry Howe Cook, Soldier of the C.S.A. in the War of the 1860's. He was later Chancellor of Davidson and Williamson Counties. He was born Nov. 23, 1843."
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: William Gustav Thuss
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Henry Howe Cook fought with D Company of the Tennessee 1st Infantry and with the Tennessee 55th Infantry. He was wounded at Murfreesboro in 1862 and taken prisoner in Virginia in 1864. Named Chief Judge of Williamson County in 1882, he authored "Story of the Six Hundred," in the Confederate Veteran, Volume 6 (March 1898), page 120.
